Articles.Content:
7 hours ago, ShadowGoat said:

I gaurantee you that the ship is not dead. I can refuel the back section and use it with a much better fuel to weight ratio, albeit less weapons. Oh wait, I can just klaw the two sections back together! Hahah. Also the ship has like 5 cores, so I doubt you killed it.

The back section im almost certain is dead according to rules, i looked inside it and didnt see any probe cores besides those on missiles which do not count.  That said, i did leave it intact, so i guess i left you with the ability to utilize that thing in the next turns.  Also, i dont really know what the state is of the front, i hit it dead center with your own missile i pirated off the rear, but since it was pitch black i couldnt really identify damage (a lot of debris flew off of it but those may have just been a missile or 2 that desintegrated).

Anyways, good luck with your move...

Edited June 18, 2017 by panzer1b

Well, i did it. After a lot of trial and error, i managed to actually get a decently bad intercept. It was stupidly hard for me, as i ended up in a lopsided orbit, but i made it work. I burned 2/3rds of the sandworms fuel doing it though, so yeah. thats not good. Anyway now for the battle report.

Heres me doing the burn, which was one of several i would end up backtracking to fix errors in the orbit before getting it right. Eventually.

Firing the missile. ONE PAWNCHHHH EVEN THOUGH I SHOT TWO MISSILES!

Damage. The ship was obliterated. The pilot survived, but theres nothing left attached to the cockpit, except for two i beams, which i suppose you could use for something. Sorry for the dark picture.

Heres the persist.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/zt5grhmw4ws47on/persistent.sfs?dl=0

Your move. Also, could you rate my ships and missiles from what youve seen so far? Thanks.
@Joseph Kerman I don't know where you got the idea that the Dauntless could shrug off G3s, I did some testing and one hit blew it apart like usual.
That most likely comes from your missile being voluminous enough to hit the core--at which point PF becomes ineffective, as, forged or not, any craft will get obliterated when it phases inside.

1 hour ago, MiffedStarfish said:

@Joseph Kerman I don't know where you got the idea that the Dauntless could shrug off G3s, I did some testing and one hit blew it apart like usual.

How far did you fire it from? Max range?

@Joseph Kerman Dude optimal range for the G3 is 1.4 km don't know how you've been testing it, but  obviously it's been wrong. Here's a tip: I was once in your position. Developed my own ships when I was a forum lurker and thought I was awesome. I got wrecked. Immediately I turned around and asked people for tips, and changed my whole building structure and now have decent ships, you need to be willing to change your design, otherwise your ships are going to go nowhere.

4 minutes ago, ShadowGoat said:

@Joseph Kerman Dude optimal range for the G3 is 1.4 km don't know how you've been testing it, but  obviously it's been wrong. Here's a tip: I was once in your position. Developed my own ships when I was a forum lurker and thought I was awesome. I got wrecked. Immediately I turned around and asked people for tips, and changed my whole building structure and now have decent ships, you need to be willing to change your design, otherwise your ships are going to go nowhere. 

1.4 to 1.7 km.
What tips would you give for vessel design? I'm curious to see what you know.
He is right though. The forum is lightyears ahead of nearly any other source because of open dialogue. You need to be open to new techniques. Which reminds me...

Build a small frame. There are two types of frames. A frame with multiple points of failure, or as you were talking about forged armor with 1 root part which can be killed with one lucky shot, but is able to lose incredible amounts of parts before lethal danger is taken, where as the multiple points of failure means that one large missing chunk can cripple a ship.
There's more structuring methods than that.

I know I just was in a rush and omitted a lot. There's also exterior and interior skeletons, but I'm not qualified to talk about exterior because I almost never use it.

Edited June 20, 2017 by ShadowGoat
I'm building some tanks, hoping to challenge someone to a in atmosphere battle. (With air strikes and possibly naval ships)
@panzer1b how'd your turn coming along?
So..... is this thread dead now?

I'm off role-playing(and abraxis snuck in), miffled is in a collab warfare thing, Kerman is doing planes, think script is busy with hat bat

 

So kinda. They won't put us in challenges with the other fighting leagues so yea...
I would be up for a battle when I get back from holiday on Sunday is anyone wants?
Awww.... this was the only thing that got me back to ksp

On 7/6/2017 at 10:48 AM, ShadowGoat said:

So..... is this thread dead now?

I can do a space battle.  I could do 200 tons for 3 ships or whatever you want if you don't like that.  Also I have sorta finished the 200 ton super ship I talked about a few pages back.  You can choose the location.
Great! Could we do 200 tons 4 ships, around Eeloo?
My last ship, the Dauntless, is not even the best ship.
Hey! I wanted to fight him miffed! Three way battle?

More people means you'll be less likely to finish.

 

glares at @AlexanderTeaH

Well @ShadowGoat asked so I replied to him, but I can battle you too, @MiffedStarfish if you want.  As Spartwo said two separate battles would likely be easier to complete and less likely to be decided by who decides to attack who.  

I'll be traveling on Sunday and Monday just so you know, I could set up now and maybe you can take your first turns while I'm gone, I'll take my turn when I come back.

Okay here is the persist.  My 4 ships are set up at Eeloo, I have 2 34-ton corvettes and 2 66-ton destroyers for a total of 200 tons.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/g7t8mgrcd8fypcm/SDJvsShadow-Eeloo.sfs?dl=0
